name: Hilton Garden Inn Portland Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, an average experience. Stayed for one night in a King room after attending a wedding in the area. We chose the room for it's convenient location and low price. (About 115 dollars including breakfast - which great for Portland) The hotel itself was nice enough - nothing fancy but modern, clean, and comfortable. Very close to the airport, which is good for travellers. Front-desk staff was efficient but not very friendly. The only really bad part of our stay was the breakfast. We arrived downstairs about 45-50 minutes before breakfast was supposed to be over, only to find very little food left. What was there was cold and unappetizing. We had already paid for the breakfast (booked through the hotel and paid extra for the it) so we went ahead and ate what we could scrape up. There was one bottle of ketchup for all the guests to share, unfortunately by the time it made it's way to us it was pretty much empty. There was no coffee left and I tried to flag down the one staff person that was flitting about the place, but to no avail. Also, it wasn't a proper restaurant, but just an area off to one side of the lobby. It felt strange sitting there and eating while people breezed in and out with suitcases. I did email the hotel once we returned home and complained about the situation, and was immediately (same day?) sent an apology from the manager, who also refunded the money paid for breakfast. I was impressed by this prompt attention to our problem, and therefore I would stay again. I'll just grab breakfast at Starbucks instead.
reviews.title: Great price, good room, fair service, bad breakfast

reviews.text: The lobby is very attractive, the staff friendly, but my room felt rather cheap. I could hear the people upstairs too much - the fixtures felt inexpensive, as well.
reviews.title: felt cheap
Surpise, found a Gem of a hotel
reviews.text: Overall a decent place, but I felt like the construction of the building was not up to par.
Went to an event a Portland Airport hotel, but the hotel for the venue was booked up so grabbed the Hilton Garden Inn in the pinch as it was down the street from the venue hotel.
reviews.title: Decent but Breakfast Ruins the Stay

likes.disliked: — Breakfast, small television, no television stations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a surprise. The front desk staff was extremely personable, you would have thought I was checking into a 5 star hotel.
reviews.title: very nice hotel, a little noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure why all the negative reviews on this property. Was here for 1 night before early morning flight out. I needed pickup from National Car rental instead of from airport and staff was extremely accommodating about it. Shuttle drivers friendly and on time. Overall decor, lobby and room met standards I expected for a Hilton Garden Inn. I stayed on a first floor room and I didn't experience any bad street noise...then again, maybe I was lucky that night along with being I am a heavy sleeper. Not too many non-fast foody places to choose from but hey, it's an airport hotel. Overall satisfied.
reviews.title: What I expected for Garden properties

reviews.text: I chose this hotel since it was close to the airport and offered a free shuttle. I got a one bedroom suite and enjoyed a nice rest. The front desk was polite, but the woman that checked me in was obviously rushed and wanted to get me out of her way as soon as possible. I understand being busy, but I was not in a hurry and would've waited for her to finish with other guests as well so that I could get the information I needed. The rooms were nice and clean and I felt safe leaving my car parked here while away on my trip. The shuttle drivers were very pleasant. The room decor is fine and the bed was comfortable. Overall, not a bad stay.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived around 4:00 pm and we asked for a room at the back of the hotel and the woman at the front desk said they were all occupied. We went to our assigned room and the noise from the road in front of the hotel was very loud. We went back to the front desk again to talk about the room location and the woman assured us the traffic would be minimal during the night... Of course, it was noisy the whole night because of the traffic. Needless to say, the staff was not that helpful.
reviews.title: Noise and promises

reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located, if you need to be near Portland International Airport, and it is moderately priced. It looks nice and is clean. But it fails to deliver on the one thing a hotel should: A good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Not a Good Night's Sleep!

reviews.text: This is a cheaply constructed wood frame building, such that floors bounce like a trampoline and walls are thin. Thus, you get to hear every footstep, every door slam, every TV set, in every nearby room, above, below next door and across the hall. And, the guests were not even being particulary noisy - just normal sounds amplified by this poor construction.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.text: I wound up staying for two nights at this hotel due to my air travel being cancelled. I chose the HGI airport because it was close and I'm an honors member. I had to make my reservation after 10pm but got the room I preferred.
reviews.title: Fabulous service!

reviews.text: The free shuttle from the airport was quick to pick me up. What wonderful drivers they had! The next day a different driver drove me to the train station so I could look around town. He made sure I had the best route, how to navigate the system and the best way to get picked up There is a Starbucks around the corner from here and a McDonald's next door if you need to clog some arteries.
reviews.title: No Surprises: Another Clean, Comfortable Hilton Garden Inn

likes.liked: — Convenient Location, Close to Airport and Rental Car Lots
likes.disliked: — Parking Lot Not Big Enough for all the Guests

reviews.text: The fitness center was small but not crowded. The food was good too. Make sure to try a microbrew while you're there.
reviews.title: Great Room, Nice Amenities

reviews.text: We arrived at PDX Airport late and grabbed the shuttle to the rental car lot. After getting the car, we were so happy to find the hotel is just a few blocks from the Thrifty car lot. We were tired, and we were quite happy with the Hilton Garden Inn PDX.
reviews.title: Great Rate, Nice Hotel, Fair Room

likes.disliked: — couch seemed a bit old and dated

reviews.text: The hotel appeared older than any previous HGI I've stayed in, but it was kept impeccably clean to Hilton standards. Check-in was quick and efficient, the bed comfortable, and everything worked. Our room had a view of the parking lot, which was not exactly interesting. There are a few fast food outlets close by, and the hotel also has a small restaurant. If you've stayed at a Hilton Garden Inn before, you won't get any surprises here. There are certainly many more interesting places to stay, but sometimes you just need/want to be close to the airport. If that's the case, and especially if you're renting a car, this hotel is well located and quite nice.
reviews.title: typical airport hotel...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one weekend night in a King Evolution room. Pleasant, comfortable, no real problems. I've stayed at all 3 of Portland's HGI (Lake Oswego, Beaverton, and PDX) now, and this property appears the oldest.
reviews.title: solid airport hotel
